orig_text: Hold $BTN_INTERACT; to burn all your offshore money

Deep inside the projects there's a fortified building, the headquarters of a local gang running a lucrative drugs operation. In this building there's a panic room bolted to the floor - and inside the panic room there's a fortune in cash. $NL; $NL;Getting into the building is easy, but the panic room is a tougher nut to crack. It'll take days to cut it open, and you don't have that much time. So if you can't get in, how are you going to get to all that money? The answer is simple: steal the whole room.

Some doors can be shot open by firing at their locks.
Police officers will not attempt to repossess loot that has not yet been bagged.
A low Detection Rate can be used in a gunfight with the Ghost Skill Tree. Just because someone's not wearing armor, doesn't mean they can't hold their own in a fight.
Most windows can be picked open. Breaking them will make lots of noise, and even civilians will be suspicious if they see broken glass.
Even suppressed saws make a little bit of noise. Be wary of nearby people.
Un-tied civilians will get back up and run off if left unattended. Use your Cable ties to avoid it.
Know your enemy. Cloakers have distinct green, glowing night vision goggles on, and make a noise when they're charging at you. You can also hear a static noise when they arrive at the scene.
ECM Jammers temporarily disable cameras. Don't be afraid to use one to blind the Camera Operator when you're in a tight spot.
If a camera sees suspicious activity, there's no stopping the alarm.
Melee weapons are always silent. If you don't have a suppressor, this is your best friend for silent takedowns.
Most guns reload faster when you have bullets left in the clip.
Know your enemy. The Medic wears bright red clothes and can quickly be identified in a crowd.
When one of your teammates has been downed, ask the rest of your team to cover you while you revive him.
While sawing doors and deposit boxes is the fastest way to open them - it's also very loud. Use the silent motor to reduce its noise.
You get detected easier if you are carrying a bag.
Hostages are your lifelines. Keep them secured, away from the action, and away from cops.
Trip mines can be placed anywhere, such as vents where Cloakers spawns, or a room you don't want cops to enter.
Be careful of tossing Grenades at cops. They can easily shoot it out of the air.
Cloakers are immune to ECM feedback.
Shotguns can take down multiple cops in a single shot. Aim for a crowd and fire away.
Know your enemy. There are two different kinds of Shields units, some are equipped with lights and SMGs, and the others carries a pistol.
Sniper Rifles can shoot through Shields and armor, and even multiple enemies.
Know your enemy. The ZEAL units all wear urban camouflage, making it harder to identify who has additional armor.
Know your enemy. The SWAT turret can be identified by being attached to a huge SWAT van.
Perk Decks can change the way you play drastically. Choose one that fits your playstyle.
The Ammo Specialist Skill Subtree is focused around ammunition. It also has skills to improve the OVE9000 Saw.
The Engineer Skill Subtree is primarily focused around the use of Sentry Guns.
The Oppressor Skill Subtree focuses boost your auto-fire weapons, making them even more effective.
The Gunslinger Skill Subtree specializes in Pistols.
The Revenant Skill Subtree is all about survival during worst case scenarios.
The Feign Death Skill in the Revenant Skill Subtree gives you a chance to get back up on your own after getting downed.
The Brawler Skill Subtree focuses on Melee weapons. Be it fists, knives, or any other melee attack.
It's often faster to swap to your fully loaded Secondary weapon then attempt to reload your Primary weapon.
Saws use ammo quickly. Bring Ammo Bags to increase their usage.
Red outlines around an enemy during a Loud heist indicates that they are a Special Enemy of some sorts.
Gage Mod Courier Packages will grant the team a free EXP bonus, regardless if they own the Gage Mod Courier DLC or not.
Bulldozers have a plate that protect their faces. You need to shoot away the plate before you can hand out headshots.
Tasing an enemy makes them a lot easier to Dominate.
Tasers can pin down your teammates, kill the Taser to help your teammates.
Enemy Snipers deal massive amount of damage that can wipe all of your armor and take a part of your health in one shot.
A silencer if very helpful when trying to sneakily complete a heist so your gunshot can't be heard.
You can press the "Shout/Interact" button to try to force a police officer to surrender and become a hostage.
If your teammates has been taken into custody you need a hostage or a dominated cop to be able to trade and get your teammate back.
Doctor Bags will give three lives back, if you only been downed once it's better to use a First Aid Kit.
Watch out for Cloakers - they attack when you least expect it. So beware of their sound.
Play with your teammates and support them - on your own, you stand less of a chance to survive.
Cloakers are not affected by the Feedback Loop of an ECM Jammer.
Sniper Rifles can penetrate thin walls. Use this to your advantage.
Getting close to enemies can cause them to deal a powerful melee attack.
Bulldozers can come charging at you when you least expect it. Stay on your toes.
Going for optional loot usually gives you more experience and money.
Getting kicked by a Cloaker or tased by Taser does not count towards your total amount times you are allowed to go down.
You can't put away your guns and mask once you've masked up. Don't mask up until you're ready for action.
Stick together to increase survivability. Or split up to do objectives faster.
Be careful where you place your bags, if a guard or a civilian sees it, they will sound the alarm.
Don't leave bodies around in Stealth, use a Body Bag to move them where they can't be seen.
Killing a guard in a cam room will let you freely roam without worrying about the cameras - but roaming guards still can detect you.
When Captain Winters is present he makes all enemies tougher to kill the longer he is present, including himself.
Got a gadget? Turn it on by pressing the "GADGET ON/OFF" button.
Do not try this in real life.
Some achievements unlock Weapons, Mods or Masks.
Your weapons, skills, armor and Perk Deck all interact differently - take the time to read about their effects.
You can use the FBI files from the game menu to read about your teammates.
Take a look at all the stats of a weapon. High damage is not always the most efficient depending on your playstyle.
Communicate with your teammates - teamwork is key to survival.
You can easily tell how many uses a placed Doctor Bag has left by looking at the amount of blood bags left inside the bag.
Join the Payday community on the Steam Store Page to gain access to some extra free and unique content.
Shield units can block bullets, try to work together to flank them or use armor piercing bullets.
Many weapons have an extended reload time if there are no bullets left in the magazine.
If the escape is available, remember to leave when you think it's best. All that money won't be worth it if you get thrown into custody.
While in the Loadout screen, take a look at the "crew setup" to see what equipment your teammates are bringing.
If you see a little ghost symbol next to a heist on Crime.net, the mission can be completed in Stealth. If there isn't one, you can only do it Loud.
Hector's jobs are mostly about violence. Dress for a fight, and bring a big gun.
Two players doing the same interaction (eg. picking a lock) doesn't make the interaction go any faster.
Profiles allow you to save your Loadout in order for you to quickly adjust your gear to the situation when being in the Loadout screen.
Some bags are heavier than others. Make sure that the player with the lowest armor carries the heaviest bag and vice versa.
When in Stealth, consider if you need to bring Body Bags or ECM Jammers to better fit your teams composition
ZEAL units are the toughest that the DHS has to offer, and are deployed only at the One Down difficulty.
Know your enemy. There are three kinds of Bulldozers: Green, Black, and Skulldozers. Each wields a different weapon.
Shields will often come in groups, make sure you have a plan to deal with them.
You can select up to four preferred heisters, in case one of them is already taken by another player.
Skill points can be reallocated with no cost. Experiment and test for yourself.
Visit the FBI files to read about the Payday gang, Special Enforcers and the Heists.
If Bain screams that someone is in a pickle - your teammates needs help.
The Butcher's Gun Trade business reaches all around the globe. She has her eyes on one-of-a-kind weaponry to steal and she knows how to settle a score.
Scarface likes his Safe House room but keeps dreaming of a mansion in Miami.
Scarface spends a fortune on furniture and decorations.
Hoxton got his nickname from being arrested in the district of Hoxton, Shoreditch, London.
Sydney's old street gang, the Dingos, are still operating back in Melbourne.
John Wick really likes his car.
Bain's favorite color might be blue. But maybe it isn't. Maybe it's red. Maybe he doesn't have one.
Bain doesn't approve of needless killing of civilians.
Bain spends a fortune on bribes and informants.
Jimmy never gets to drive the escape van.
Dallas spends a fortune on nice suits.
Dallas is not from Texas, he's from Chicago.
Dallas doesn't like going to the dentist.
Wolf spends a fortune on power tools.
Wolf used to work as a game developer in Sweden.
Bodhi spends a fortune on surfboards.
Bodhi isn't just in it for the money.
Chains used to be a military man but he didn't fit in. As a bank robber, he's a natural.
Clover spends a fortune on electronics.
Clover has had a long and complicated relationship with Hoxton, since before the Payday Gang. They get on well now, though.
Clover's name is a reference to her being a lucky heister. And she is.
Jimmy spends a fortune on cocaine.
Houston spends a fortune on cars.
Houston has many problems, but the cops ain't one.
Houston thinks Hoxton is an idiot.
Houston likes to keep an eye on the escape van, making sure it's in good shape.
Bonnie spends a fortune on whisky.
Bonnie used to be a honeymoon murderer, marrying and then murdering her husbands for insurance money.
Captain Winters spends a fortune on protective gear.
Jimmy has declared that he will empty the Safe House bar faster than Aldstone can refill it. It's a titanic struggle with an unclear outcome.
Captain Winters is not a kind leader.
Captain Winters used to be in the Military Police before he joined GenSec.
Rust betrayed a strong brotherhood to join the Payday Gang.
Sokol spends a fortune on ice hockey gear.
Sokol watches the Russian hockey league every week.
Sokol still maintains the physique of a professional athlete.
Sokol enjoys the fact that he still has fans in Russia from his ice hockey days.
Jiro spends a fortune on sword maintenance.
Dragan used to be a cop in Croatia.
Dragan was introduced to the Payday Gang by the Butcher.
Aldstone spends a fortune on specially imported tea.
Aldstone's first name is unknown to all the heisters except Hoxton, who never uses it.
Aldstone doesn't like Hoxton's choice of profession, but as a loyal and professional butler he stoically accepts it.
Gage doesn't like everything about his job, but he does have a passion for the merchandise.
Gage is often underestimated, something which he uses to his advantage.
Gage has an extensive net of contacts around the world, allowing him to procure the very best hardware available.
Bob McKendrick is a political veteran of many battles and has gone through many ups and downs during his career.
The Butcher's signature and mode of operation is to transport guns inside frozen animal carcasses.
Jiro doesn't like the Cloaker. He cuts their head off with his Katana.
Bodhi despises Tasers. Try shooting one with the Platypus Sniper Rifle when playing as him.
No animals were hurt during the making of the Goat Simulator Heist.
Events are heists that take place during special events, like Halloween. Expect some crazy things to happen.
The Dentist's jobs require careful planning and finesse. If you think you're ready, give him a call.
The Classics. These jobs were the biggest things the gang's ever done. Let's say we see if they still have what it takes?
Make your way further along the bridge and locate the prison convoy.
Escort the prisoner to the top of the right tower. When he's at the top, strap him down in the chair and send him skyward with the balloon.
Escort the prisoner to the scaffolding
Hold the tower, wait for the airplane and make sure the pilot snatches up the chair!
Make it to the Bridge Pillar and take the stairs to the waiting scuba gear.
Clear this area of cops, or Bile will have to look for another spot to pick you up.
Move up the Hill with Matt
Get Matt to the rope ladder under the helicopter and rally the team around it.
Use gasoline to set the van on fire and force Matt out.
Bile will pick you up soon, dig in!
Press jump to be released from custody
